guide.hero_title: The Ultimate Guide to the Love Lock Bridge Paris

guide.intro_title: Is the Paris Lock Bridge still open?
guide.intro_text: The famous **Love Lock Bridge Paris** (Pont des Arts) is still open to pedestrians, but placing physical locks has been illegal since 2015. The city removed 45 tons of metal from this **bridge with locks in Paris** to prevent collapse. Today, the only legal way to leave a mark is via the **Love Lock Paris** digital registry.
guide.history_title: History of the Lock of Love Bridge
guide.history_text: The tradition of the **locks bridge Paris** started around 2008. By 2014, the **lock bridge in France** was carrying so much weight that a railing collapsed. This event marked the end of the physical **love locks bridge paris** era and the beginning of the Augmented Reality solution.
guide.location_title: Where is the Lock Bridge Paris?
guide.location_text: The original **Love Lock Bridge** is the Pont des Arts. It connects the Institut de France to the Louvre Museum in the 6th arrondissement. GPS: 48.8583° N, 2.3374° E.
guide.solution_title: The New Love Lock Bridge Paris (2026)
guide.solution_text: Since physical locks are banned, **Love Lock Paris** created the official digital alternative. You can now place a virtual lock on the **Paris lock bridge** using your phone. It is eternal, eco-friendly, and visible via Augmented Reality.
